text.desc: Imature water can conduct electricity, can't plug or pull the plug with wet hands
Do not use wires with damaged insulation to avoid electric shock
Replace the lamp, move the appliance, etc., first cut off the power switch
Wires, sockets, plugs, etc. should be replaced in time for their service life
Do not overload the socket to prevent fire hazard
Use electrical appliances, plugs, etc. that need to be grounded, be sure to operate as required to prevent safety hazards
The appliance should be kept away from the easily conductive sink
When someone is found to have an electric shock, immediately turn off the power. When the power cannot be turned off, use an insulator such as a dry stick to open the wire.
